## Progressive Enhancement with SvelteKit Form Actions

Progressive enhancement in SvelteKit allows forms to work even when JavaScript is disabled in the browser, while providing enhanced user experience when JavaScript is available.

### How it works:

1. **Without JavaScript**: Forms work using traditional server-side form submission with full page reloads
2. **With JavaScript**: The `use:enhance` action intercepts form submissions and handles them with client-side AJAX requests, avoiding full page reloads

### Basic Implementation:

You can progressively enhance a form by simply adding `use:enhance` to your form element:

```svelte
<!-- src/routes/login/+page.svelte -->
<script>
	import { enhance } from '$app/forms';
</script>

<form method="POST" use:enhance>
	<label>
		Email
		<input name="email" type="email" />
	</label>
	<label>
		Password
		<input name="password" type="password" />
	</label>
	<button>Log in</button>
</form>
```

```js
// src/routes/login/+page.server.js
/** @satisfies {import('./$types').Actions} */
export const actions = {
	default: async (event) => {
		// Handle form submission
		const data = await event.request.formData();
		// Process login logic
		return { success: true };
	}
};
```

### Customized Enhancement:

For more control over the enhancement behavior, you can provide a callback to `use:enhance`:

```svelte
<!-- Customized form enhancement -->
<script>
	import { enhance } from '$app/forms';
	
	let isLoading = false;
</script>

<form
	method="POST"
	use:enhance={() => {
		isLoading = true;
		
		return async ({ update }) => {
			isLoading = false;
			// Use default behavior
			update();
		};
	}}
>
	<!-- form fields -->
	<button>
		{#if isLoading}
			Submitting...
		{:else}
			Submit
		{/if}
	</button>
</form>
```

The `use:enhance` action provides seamless progressive enhancement by:
- Working without JavaScript (traditional form submission)
- Enhancing with JavaScript (AJAX submission without page reloads)
- Handling redirects, validation errors, and success states automatically
- Resetting forms and updating page state appropriately

This approach ensures your forms work for all users regardless of their JavaScript settings while providing an improved experience for those with JavaScript enabled.<|im_end|>
